alert.note: Alert for Matanuska Valley (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued December 22 at 10:16PM AKST by NWS Anchorage
info.description: ...STRONG WINDS, SNOW AND RAIN SATURDAY EVENING THROUGH SUNDAY MORNING... A strong area of low pressure moving into the Susitna Valley from the Kenai Peninsula will bring a combination of strong winds, snow, and rain to the Matanuska Valley Saturday night through Sunday morning. The northeasterly winds that developed Friday evening will continue into Saturday before increasing in intensity Saturday night as the low approaches the area. Expect wind gusts of 45 to 60 mph between 8 PM Satuday and 4 AM Sunday as the area of low pressure moves through the area. Winds will then shift to the south and diminish through Sunday morning as the low moves north. Areas of light mixed rain/snow transitioning to all snow is possible Sunday morning as the low exits the region and colder air moves into the valley. Any snow accumulation will be light, with up to 2 inches of snow possible.
